message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.DS

The paper deals with the security and connectivity of wireless sensor networks, which are typically studied in the computer science subfields of cryptography (cs.CR), networking and internet architecture (cs.NI), information theory (cs.IT), systems and control (cs.SY), and distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DS). Given the focus on security and resilience against node capture attacks, cs.CR and cs.NI are the most likely sub-categories. The analysis of scheme parameters and network connectivity also suggests cs.IT and cs.SY as possible sub-categories. Finally, the use of probabilistic key predistribution schemes and the investigation of node replication attacks align with the scope of cs.DS.
